page.title: 01ROYAL BURGH OF INVERURIE
page.content:
The Royal Burgh of Inverurie is situated in Gordon District in Grampian Region. The town is sixteen miles North West of the city of Aberdeen and it stands at the point where the River Don is joined by its tributary the River Urie.
The name Inverurie means at the mouth of the Urie. The town motto is URBS IN RURE, which means the town in the country. This is exactly what Inverurie is. It is a town situated in a rural area which is known as the Garioch. (pronounced "GEE REE")
Overlooking the town to the west is the hill of Bennachie, which rises to a height of 518 metres and dominates the surrounding countryside.
